item.title: Book Notes: The Phoenix Project
item.author: contact@dougiepeart.co.uk (Dougie Peart)
item.description: Source Author: Gene Kim Title: The Phoenix Project Year: 2013 Genre: Technology Rating: 8/10 The Book in 3 Sentences If you were to take over a traditional IT organisation weighed down with decades of technical debt, how could you turn things around? Bill Palmer is the new reluctant VP of IT operations and he needs to figure this out for himself before his company goes under. Bill discovers that the answers are closer than he realises, and by studying the manufacturing process in his own company he can apply an agile methodology to the IT organisation.

item.title: Book Notes: The Beginner's guide to Stoicism
item.author: contact@dougiepeart.co.uk (Dougie Peart)
item.description: Source Author: Matthew Van Natta Title: The Beginner’s Guide to Stoicism Year: 2019 Genre: Philosophy Rating: 9/10 The Book in 3 Sentences This book introduces the tools one needs to deal with life’s challenges in a calm and composed manner. You already possess the keys to living a fulfilling and joyous life. Despite having been created centuries ago, its teachings still apply to modern life. Impressions I found it immensely useful.
